overview: The purpose of this measure is to appropriate funds for the operating and capital improvement costs of the Judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning on July 1, 2025, and ending on June 30, 2027. [14] This Act shall be known and may be cited as the Judiciary Appropriations Act of 2025. [13] Your Committee on Conference has amended this measure by inserting appropriate operating and capital improvement amounts for fiscal biennium 2025-2027 and changing the effective date to July 1, 2025. [14]
appropriations: This budget measure, as amended, appropriates general fund operating totals of $201,725,676 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) for FY 2025-2026 and $199,579,345 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) for FY 2026-2027. [14] Of the general fund appropriation for administration (JUD601), the sum of $2,218,922 (HB400_CD1_.HTM.txt) is for fiscal year 2025-2026 for salary adjustments as recommended by the commission on salaries. [13] The measure also appropriates capital improvement totals from general obligation bonds of $12,900,000 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) for FY 2025-2026. [14]
assumptions_and_methodology: The sums appropriated are to accomplish the purposes and programs designated for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2027. [13] The total expenditures and the number of permanent and temporary positions established in each fiscal year shall not exceed the sums and the position ceilings indicated. [13] The chief justice may transfer sufficient funds and positions between programs for operating purposes when the need arises. [13]
agency_impact: The judiciary is appropriated funds for its various programs, including the Courts of Appeal, the First, Second, Third, and Fifth Judicial Circuits, the Judicial Selection Commission, and Administration. [13] [13] [13] The chief justice may transfer funds between programs to implement any salary adjustments. [13] The judiciary may delegate the planning, acquisition of land, design, construction, and equipment of any capital improvement project to other state or county agencies when it is determined to be advantageous to do so. [13]
economic_impact: Appropriations support the operations of The Judicial System, a core function of state government. [13] The measure appropriates $12,900,000 (HB400_CD1_.HTM.txt) for capital improvement projects such as general alterations, upgrades, and improvements to Judiciary facilities statewide, which will support economic activity. [13] [13] A sum of $2,218,922 (HB400_CD1_.HTM.txt) from the general fund appropriation for administration shall be expended for salary adjustments. [13]
policy_impact: This measure enacts the Judiciary Appropriations Act of 2025. [13] It provides the necessary funding for the operating and capital improvement costs of the Judiciary for the fiscal biennium. [14] The Act also authorizes the issuance of general obligation bonds to finance authorized capital improvement projects. [13]
revenue_sources: Funding sources specified in this Act include general funds (A), special funds (B), general obligation bond funds (C), and revolving funds (W). [13] [13] General obligation bonds may be issued to yield the amount necessary to finance projects, provided that the sum total of the general obligation bonds so issued shall not exceed $12,900,000 (HB400_CD1_.HTM.txt). [13] The judiciary may also secure federal funds or funds from private organizations or individuals. [13]
six_year_fiscal_implications: This Act appropriates funds for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2027. [13] As amended, this budget measure appropriates general fund operating totals of $201,725,676 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) for FY 2025-2026 and $199,579,345 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) for FY 2026-2027. [14] The total operating appropriations from all means of finance are $214,571,429 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) for FY 2025-2026 and $212,425,098 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) for FY 2026-2027. [14] For capital improvements, the budget appropriates $12,900,000 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) in general obligation bonds for FY 2025-2026. [14] A specific appropriation of $2,218,922 (HB400_CD1_.HTM.txt) from the general fund is designated for salary adjustments in FY 2025-2026. [13] The appropriations for capital improvement projects shall not lapse at the end of the fiscal year for which the appropriations are made. [13] All other appropriations for FY 2025-2026 and FY 2026-2027 that are unencumbered as of June 30, 2028, shall lapse as of that date. [13] These appropriations establish the baseline for future Judiciary budgets. [13]
operating_revenue_impact: The provided documents do not contain any information regarding impacts on operating revenues. [13] [14] The bill focuses on appropriations and expenditures for the Judiciary's operations and capital projects. [13] [13]
capital_expenditure_impact: The sum of $12,900,000 (HB400_CD1_.HTM.txt) is appropriated in part II for capital improvement projects. [13] These projects include the Kauai Judiciary Complex Chiller Replacement, Lump Sum CIP for Judiciary Facilities statewide, and the South Kohala District Courthouse. [13] [13] [13] The chief justice shall determine when and the manner in which the authorized capital improvement projects shall be initiated. [13]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: The appropriations made for capital improvement projects will not lapse at the end of the fiscal year, allowing for long-term project completion. [13] All unrequired balances in the general obligation bond fund after project objectives have been met shall be transferred to the judiciary project adjustment fund. [13] All operating appropriations for fiscal years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027 that are unencumbered as of June 30, 2028, will lapse. [13]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: General fund operating appropriations have been updated to $201,725,676 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) for FY 2025-2026 and $199,579,345 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) for FY 2026-2027. fte_positions: The measure establishes the maximum number of permanent or temporary positions authorized for a particular program, referred to as the "Position ceiling". [13] For the fiscal biennium, position ceilings are set for each program within the Judicial System, such as 1,115.50 permanent positions for the First Judicial Circuit. [13] [13] No new specific FTE positions are added in this version of the bill. [13] [14]

reports_required: If any manifest clerical, typographical, or other mechanical error is found in this Act, the chief justice may correct the error. [13] All changes made pursuant to this section shall be reported to the legislature at its next regular session. [13]
